author: Caroline Moorehead
title: ‘A Dangerous Woman’ Review: Opportunism Knocks
text:
‘To hold on to your man,” Florence Gould told a friend, “you need to occupy him. You make love together for, what? An hour? Maybe only half an hour? Then you have twenty-three other hours to fill.” From a very young age, Florence—social climber, businesswoman, grande horizontale, patron of the arts—perfected the art of filling the hours of her lovers. She was never without a man.
Susan Ronald’s “A Dangerous Woman” introduces us to young Florence Lacaze, born in 1895 to a Frenchman who had immigrated to California and clawed...
